subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... If I am to decide whether I want tested (i.e. known to work) code, or a small public (or even published) interface, I clearly go for the former. Robert
messageBody:
On Thursday 01 September 2005 13:49, Elliotte Harold wrote:
> If extracting a class causes a method to become public that otherwise
> wouldn't be public, then it's a problem.

If I am to decide whether I want tested (i.e. known to work) code, or a
small public (or even published) interface, I clearly go for the former.

Robert
